newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy police uncover 12 trln lire in unpaid taxes.
newsitem.headline: Italy police uncover 12 trln lire in unpaid taxes.

text.p: Italian tax police uncovered a total of 12 trillion lire in unpaid taxes in the first seven months of 1997, newspapers said at the weekend.
Il Sole 24 Ore newspaper said a report from the tax police to the interior ministry showed investigators found 12 trillion lire in unpaid levies on undeclared taxable assets and non-deductible costs.
Violations on value-added tax totalled a further 2.8 trillion lire.
More than 3,200 people were found to be evading taxes either partially or entirely, daily Il Corriere Della Sera said.
